Title: AI_Existential_Risk_Factor
Description: Current and near-term AI technologies can contribute to existential risk by acting as intermediate risk factors.

Title: AI_Intermediate_Factor
Description: Current and near-term AI technologies can act as intermediate risk factors, magnifying the likelihood of previously identified sources of existential risk.

Title: Risk_Not_Limited_To_AGI
Description: This potential contribution to existential risk is not limited to the unaligned AGI scenario.

Title: Causal_Pathways_Exist
Description: There exist causal pathways from AI systems to existential risks that do not presuppose hypothetical future AI capabilities.

Title: AI_Affects_Power_Dynamics
Description: AI can shift or strengthen existing power dynamics between different actors.

Title: AI_State_State_Risk
Description: AI can disturb relationships between nation states, potentially leading to an "AI arms race."

Title: AI_State_Corporation_Risk
Description: The rise of tech corporations affects their relationships with states, creating power imbalances.

Title: AI_State_Citizen_Risk
Description: AI surveillance technologies change the dynamics between states and citizens.

Title: AI_State_State_Risk
Description: AI affects relationships between states in ways that can increase existential risk.

Title: AI_Global_Power_Shift
Description: AI development contributes to a global shift in power towards nations like China ("Easternisation").

Title: AI_Arms_Race
Description: Concerns about technological competition can lead to an "AI arms race" between nations.

Title: Competition_Inhibits_Coordination
Description: Such competitive dynamics may inhibit international coordination and incentivize against AI safety precautions.

Title: AI_State_Corporation_Risk
Description: AI affects relationships between states and corporations in ways that can increase existential risk.

Title: Tech_Corporation_Rise
Description: The past two decades have seen a monumental rise of private corporations in the technology sector with revenues comparable to national GDPs.

Title: Corporate_Global_Reach
Description: These corporations operate globally, making state regulation challenging.

Title: Profit_Driven_Goals
Description: Many corporate goals are profit-driven and can be misaligned with wider societal interests.

Title: AI_State_Citizen_Risk
Description: AI surveillance technologies enable potential stable repressive regimes that could constitute existential catastrophes.

Title: AI_Surveillance_Growth
Description: There's been a rapid increase in the use of AI surveillance systems by states across different political systems.

Title: Insufficient_Ethical_Frameworks
Description: Ethical and legal frameworks for these technologies are lagging behind their deployment.

Title: Surveillance_Privatization
Description: Private companies develop and sell surveillance technologies to governments, further normalizing mass surveillance.

Title: AI_State_State_Risk
Description: AI affects relationships between states, potentially creating tensions.

Title: Cybersecurity_Intelligence_Impact
Description: Changes in cybersecurity could affect a state's intelligence capabilities.

Title: AI_Information_Ecosystem_Risk
Description: AI threatens the information ecosystem, as seen with COVID-19 misinformation.

Title: Response_Requires_Trust
Description: Effective pandemic response requires public trust in political systems.

Title: AI_Biological_Weapons
Description: AI could be used to design and produce dangerous pathogens.

Title: AI_Information_Ecosystem_Risk
Description: AI threatens the information ecosystem through misinformation.

Title: AI_Arms_Race
Description: Concerns about technological competition can lead to an "AI arms race" between nations or corporations.

Title: Safety_Corner_Cutting
Description: Competitive dynamics may incentivize corner-cutting on AI safety.

Title: AI_Surveillance_Growth
Description: Rapid increase in AI surveillance technologies globally.

Title: Lagging_Ethical_Frameworks
Description: Even democratic countries fail to meet regulatory standards for surveillance.

Title: Surveillance_Privatization
Description: Private-public partnerships normalize surveillance beyond legal limits.
